docs.snippet: Nate Silver is providing awards-season insight for Carpetbagger leading up to the 83rd Academy Awards on Feb. 27. Mr. Silver is the author of The Times's FiveThirtyEight blog, which is devoted to the analysis of statistics and data in politics and...
docs.lead_paragraph: Nate Silver is providing awards-season insight for Carpetbagger leading up to the 83rd Academy Awards on Feb. 27. Mr. Silver is the author of The Times's FiveThirtyEight blog, which is devoted to the analysis of statistics and data in politics and other areas. Two years ago, I tried to predict the Oscar winners for New York Magazine by crunching data from the last 30 years of awards history. The project was a mixed success. I got 4 out of 6 categories right, an acceptable score on paper. But several of the choices (like ''Slumdog Millionaire'' for Best Picture) were giveaways and conversely, the system's longshot pick -- Taraji P. Henson for her role in ''The Curious Case of Benjamin Button'' -- was a total flop.
docs.abstract: Nate Silver uncovers four key tips for predicting Academy Awards winners. Photos (M)

headline.main: A Simplified System (4 Rules) for Winning The Office Oscar Pool

docs.snippet: Will Wall Street win over Hollywood?     ''Inside Job,'' the Oscar-nominated documentary directed by Charles Ferguson, takes a piercing look at the financial crisis. Told through the lens of economists like Nouriel Roubini and investors like Georg...
docs.lead_paragraph: Will Wall Street win over Hollywood? ''Inside Job,'' the Oscar-nominated documentary directed by Charles Ferguson, takes a piercing look at the financial crisis. Told through the lens of economists like Nouriel Roubini and investors like George Soros, the film lays much of the blame on Wall Street and a revolving door of regulators, many of whom came straight from the big banks.
docs.abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin interview with documentary filmmaker Charles Ferguson who says he does not feel much has changed in financial industry since making movie Inside Job, and he worries about repeat of crisis; photo (M)

headline.main: After Exposé, Filmmaker Sees Little Change on Wall Street

docs.abstract: Melena Ryzik The Carpetbagger column says that normally staid Academy Awards telecast will embrace new media, with live-streaming backstage moments on revamped Web site and interactivity that will allow fans to submit questions for nominees online.

docs.snippet: The rules-of-thumb for predicting the Oscar winners....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two years ago, I tried to predict the Oscar winners by crunching data from the last 30 years of awards history. The project was a mixed success. But I've dusted off the database and aimed to simplify it - boiling it down to a few core factors that have been especially reliable predictors in the past. Here, then, over at the Carpetbagger, are the rules-of-thumb for predicting the Oscars. Read more.
docs.abstract: The rules-of-thumb for predicting the Oscar winners.
